snippet.textDisplay:
Not to be confused with a famous movie rhyme... This is an example of... "A Game for those who seek to find, a way to leave their world behind."

Starting this up, and hearing this at the start... goes to show, you're about to leave and enter into a world like no other.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: Friggin love the little detail of the Monado lighting up near the end of the song. Even this fucking title screen tells a story. Thumbs up to the devs. Im playing this on the 3ds and the timer to show how long youve played for is at 9 fucking hours. i played for 3 yesterday. Can't wait to finish this game for the first time, this is also the first game i havn't seen a single gameplay video of so i can keep all the plot twists, secrets and heartwarming moments for MY gameplay. cant wait to %100 the whole game.
snippet.textOriginal: Friggin love the little detail of the Monado lighting up near the end of the song. Even this fucking title screen tells a story. Thumbs up to the devs. Im playing this on the 3ds and the timer to show how long youve played for is at 9 fucking hours. i played for 3 yesterday. Can't wait to finish this game for the first time, this is also the first game i havn't seen a single gameplay video of so i can keep all the plot twists, secrets and heartwarming moments for MY gameplay. cant wait to %100 the whole game.

snippet.textDisplay: I wasn't really hit by this song much, until I payed attention to the video and the sound instead of just the sound. It was surprising how much that simple scene of a lone sword in grass actually portrayed. A peaceful dawn, but the mechons come and sorrow follows, pretty much humanities only hope of survival is that sword. As the world darkens, the Monado is seen as a glowing beacon of hope.
snippet.textOriginal: I wasn't really hit by this song much, until I payed attention to the video and the sound instead of just the sound. It was surprising how much that simple scene of a lone sword in grass actually portrayed. A peaceful dawn, but the mechons come and sorrow follows, pretty much humanities only hope of survival is that sword. As the world darkens, the Monado is seen as a glowing beacon of hope.

snippet.textDisplay:
I completely agree with you and never thought about it that way. It's those simple and subtle things that make Xenoblade Chronicles such a beautiful game. Don't know if this counts as spoilers, so just in case, spoilers. 





Also just wanted to add, what makes your comment more ironic is that while the Monado IS their only hope, it's also the reason that all of this happened. The Monado almost led to their downfall, and yet, they rely on it so much simply because they have no other choice.
snippet.textOriginal:
I completely agree with you and never thought about it that way. It's those simple and subtle things that make Xenoblade Chronicles such a beautiful game. Don't know if this counts as spoilers, so just in case, spoilers. 





Also just wanted to add, what makes your comment more ironic is that while the Monado IS their only hope, it's also the reason that all of this happened. The Monado almost led to their downfall, and yet, they rely on it so much simply because they have no other choice.

snippet.textDisplay: I absolutely love this main theme.  It's one of my favorite ever in a video game.  I am fine playing this game on a Wii.  I really need to get back to playing this game, I'm just stuck at an important part in the story.  Also, one of the best soundtracks I have ever listened to for an RPG.  This soundtrack is easily in my top 10 of all time.

snippet.textDisplay: I absolutely love the soundtrack on this game, it's fantastic, but I just couldn't complete it. I found that the incessant shouting during Combat just marred the whole experience for me; and with no audio sliders or ability to turn down the racket, it just completely put me off. I'm hoping they add that option to the New 3DS version, at least so I can play through it without having to cry over the ruined battle soundtrack.
snippet.textOriginal: I absolutely love the soundtrack on this game, it's fantastic, but I just couldn't complete it. I found that the incessant shouting during Combat just marred the whole experience for me; and with no audio sliders or ability to turn down the racket, it just completely put me off. I'm hoping they add that option to the New 3DS version, at least so I can play through it without having to cry over the ruined battle soundtrack.

snippet.textDisplay: Just a few days after I've set up the Dolphin so I can play this game with the best graphics possible, Nintendo announced a port for the New 3DS. How does everyone feel about the new handheld? At first I thought it was just another small revision, but it actually has more power, 4 shoulder buttons and a sort of 2nd stick, mostly to help control the camera. Xenoblade is the first game announced for it and they clearly said it won't work on a normal 3DS. I have to say, eventhough I will end up buying the New 3DS, Nintendo really is making it all confusing. I'm sure I'll see people buy New 3DS games for their normal 3DS, just like I've seen people buy Wii U games for their Wii.
snippet.textOriginal: Just a few days after I've set up the Dolphin so I can play this game with the best graphics possible, Nintendo announced a port for the New 3DS. How does everyone feel about the new handheld? At first I thought it was just another small revision, but it actually has more power, 4 shoulder buttons and a sort of 2nd stick, mostly to help control the camera. Xenoblade is the first game announced for it and they clearly said it won't work on a normal 3DS. I have to say, eventhough I will end up buying the New 3DS, Nintendo really is making it all confusing. I'm sure I'll see people buy New 3DS games for their normal 3DS, just like I've seen people buy Wii U games for their Wii.

snippet.textDisplay:
I really think their timing sucked here, I mean, they just released the new Super Smash Bros. for the 3DS, which was the main reason for me buying the 3DS. Now people are saying, "Oh, you screwed up, you should have waited."
Well, I waited for Nintendo to convince me to buy a 3DS, and they came through. Now they'll have to convince me all over again. And meanwhile, I'll be enjoying both classic and modern games on my fresh-out-of-the-box 3DS XL.
snippet.textOriginal:
I really think their timing sucked here, I mean, they just released the new Super Smash Bros. for the 3DS, which was the main reason for me buying the 3DS. Now people are saying, "Oh, you screwed up, you should have waited."
Well, I waited for Nintendo to convince me to buy a 3DS, and they came through. Now they'll have to convince me all over again. And meanwhile, I'll be enjoying both classic and modern games on my fresh-out-of-the-box 3DS XL.
